decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: 23MT/2/1/SITE/01  Rev 02; 23MT/2/2/GA/21 Rev 03; 23MT/2/3/GA/42 Rev 03; Site Location Plan

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Condition:
The development hereby approved shall implement the flood mitigation
measures as submitted with the proposal titled: EA FRA Matrix. These
measures shall thereafter be retained in perpetuity

Reason: To reduce the risk of flooding and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy SI 13 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS16 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policy DM F2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014

Condition : 5 - Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, a scheme identifying biodiversity/ecological enhancements to be achieved on the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved measures shall be implemented prior to the first occupation/use of the development hereby approved and shall be retained thereafter. 

Reason: To ensure that the development mitigates against habitat loss and enhances biodiversity in accordance with London Plan policy G6, Merton's Core Strategy policy CS21 and Merton's Sites, Policies Plan policy DM O2

Condition : 6 - Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, a scheme for the provision of surface water drainage shall be submitted and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The agreed measures shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved and shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure satisfactory means of surface water drainage, to reduce the risk of flooding and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy SI 13 of the London Plan 2021, policy CS16 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policy DM F2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved without delay

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE: 
Planning permission is not an overarching right to build and there may be other legal matters to consider including consent from the land owner
